title: RayBan's "Genuine since 1937" & "NEVER HIDE" font ID
content:
Hello:

I'm looking for the font used on the phrase "Genuine since 1937"...

 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20150221091229im_/http:/typophile.com/files/RayBan_6089.jpg)

Well, if anyone knows this one too would be cool...

 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20150221091229im_/http:/typophile.com/files/NeverHide_5425.jpg)

Any help would be appreciated...

Thanks!!

Q™ says: It's all about the fonts!!
author: Quesito

comments.content:
Update:

Nevermind about the second one, it's DIN Condensed Bold... I just try it and it fits...

Q™ Says: It's all about the Fonts!!
The second one isn’t DIN but [Trade Gothic Bold Condensed](http://web.archive.org/web/20150221091229/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/linotype/trade-gothic/bold-condensed-no-20-63882/).

Jan:

You're right, actually, it didn't fit quite well, but DIN did the work 'cause I was in a hurry...

Any ideas about the other one?

Q™ Says: It's all about the Fonts!!
If "close enough" is OK, then use Eurostile/Microgramma for "genuine..."
